Title: Strategic Flood Risk Assessment (Level 1), Water Cycle Study and Flood Risk Assessment of Allocated Sites for South Worcestershire Development Plan Review
Description: Malvern Hills District Council invited Tenders from Potential Consultants on behalf of the South Worcestershire Councils (SWC) (Malvern Hills District Council, Worcester City Council and Wychavon District Council) for the provision of a Level 1 Strategic Flood Risk Assessment (SFRA) including a Water Cycle Study (WCS) (stage 1) and a Flood Risk Assessment of Allocated Sites (stage 2).  The SWDPR is seeking to balance the areas future needs for housing and employment growth with its environmental limitations (including flood risk). The SWC initially require a level 1 SFRA and associated Water Cycle Study to identify the potential flood risks across the districts, followed by further flood risk assessment work to determine the suitability of 'preferred' development sites as they emerge through the SWDPR process to help produce a robust, detailed and up to date evidence base.  Following on from this a further stage of work may be required to produce a more detailed assessment of the flooding implications of options for development sites only if land outside flood risk areas can't appropriately accommodate all the necessary development and the National Planning Policy Framework's Exception Test needs to be applied (separate to this tender).  All work produced must factor in Climate Change and assess the impact that land use changes and development in the area will have on flood risk.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Jeremy Benn Associates LTD|South Barn, Broughton Hall, Skipton, North Yorkshire, BD23 3AE|NONE||No|No]

Title: CBC, HDC, MSDC, RBBC - Gatwick Sub-Region Water Cycle Study & SFRA - AWARD
Description:
Crawley Borough Council (CBC), Horsham District Council (HDC), Mid Sussex District Council (MSDC) and Reigate & Banstead Borough Council (RBBC) are inviting tenders to undertake a Water Cycle Study to inform their emerging Local/District Plans. As part of this commission a Strategic Flood Risk Assessment will be required by CBC and HDC only, for the parts of their administrative areas that fall within the catchment of the Upper River Mole.
      
      The Councils are procuring this contract following an open local tender process.  The duration of the Contracts are anticipated to be between four and five months. It is anticipated that the contracts will commence in late November 2019. The Councils intend to award the tender to one organisation, and each Council will be issuing its own Contract to the winning bidder.
